required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multicenter Outcome Registry of AnaLgesic Effect of SCS(MORALES) Registry Protocol
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter Outcome Registry of AnaLgesic Effect of SCS(MORALES) Registry Protocol

brief_summary.textblock: The objective is to provide information to help the physician community decide the most effective type of device/therapy that would work for their patients, based off of the etiology of pain, the location of the pain for sustained pain relief.

detailed_description.textblock: This registry will enroll patients that qualify for an SCS implant, for approved pain areas, as defined by medicare guidelines, and follow these patients for up to 12 months for denovo implants. For patients who have lost their pain relief over time, with a prior implanted device, this registry will follow a change out to another vendor/therapy, and follow those patients for up to 12 months.

primary_outcome.description: Percent of patient who show a change in Pain Scale (PIPS) >50% at the end of follow up period of 12 months

other_outcome.measure: Sustained change of pain over the follow up period
other_outcome.description: Sustained Percentage change in Pain Scale (PIPS)>50% for the 12 month follow up period.

intervention.description: Conventional SCS implants approved through all payors(government and private) for FDA approved indications

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- FDA approved indications for SCS implants, for commercial and government(medicare, medi-cal etc) approved payors
Exclusion Criteria:
-
